call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - June 5th

topics.title: Ergo 6.0 RC6 Release and Testing
topics.summary: Kushti announces the release of Ergo 6.0 RC6, hopefully the final release candidate, which differs from the final release only in maintenance warning height. Additional testing is being conducted before the final release.

topics.title: Conference Schedule and Korean Blockchain Week
topics.summary: Kushti discusses upcoming conference appearances including Korean Blockchain Week in September and a Dubai visit in July. He's making arrangements with Korean peers and mentions Google Summer of Code projects bringing new contributors.

topics.title: AI-Themed Hackathon Results and Community Growth
topics.summary: Discussion of the recent AI-themed hackathon that brought new developers, including miners who built apps using AI tools. Community voting will be conducted for additional rewards beyond the EF awards.

topics.title: AI Development Tools and Ergo Integration
topics.summary: Kushti shares experiences using AI for coding, noting dangerous hallucinations in complex algorithms but usefulness for trivial tasks like writing tests. Discussion of AI tools for ErgoScript development and contract templates.

topics.title: AI Tool Preferences and Productivity
topics.summary: Discussion of preferred AI tools including DeepSeek for text, Claude Sonnet and Cursor IDE for code. Both speakers share experiences with AI limitations and the importance of knowing when to stop using AI assistance.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge Kaspa and Tari Integration
topics.summary: Brief discussion of Kaspa and Tari integration buzz around Rosen Bridge, with both projects now communicating with the Rosen team. Kushti emphasizes that Rosen Bridge is an application, not a competitor to blockchains.

topics.title: Palm Economy Africa Expansion Plans
topics.summary: Dan discusses Palm Economy's expansion into cocoa and pineapple supply chains in Nigeria and Benin, addressing supply chain standardization issues and quality control problems that result in 30% waste.

topics.title: Blockchain Ethos and Community Initiative
topics.summary: Dan emphasizes the importance of building businesses on Ergo rather than expecting others to promote it, discussing the need to move away from entitlement mentality and take initiative to create real enterprises.

topics.title: Supply Chain Transparency and Corruption
topics.summary: Discussion of how blockchain can provide transparency in supply chains, using olive oil industry corruption as an example. Emphasis on giving consumers choice through transparent tracking rather than preventing bad actors.

topics.title: Ergo Meetup 2025 Colorado Schedule
topics.summary: Detailed schedule for the October 11th Colorado meetup including speakers (LGD, MiGoreng on palm staking, qx() on Lithos protocol), AI vs Old Timer Devs hackathon, group activities, and live streaming plans.

topics.title: Ergo Mining Setup in Argentina
topics.summary: Response to community question about setting up Ergo miners in Argentina, directing them to the Sigmanauts mining pool community for step-by-step guidance and support.

topics.title: Banxa Integration On-Ramp Raffle
topics.summary: Discussion of new Banxa integration for direct ERG purchases with credit cards, available in most countries except New York, Hawaii, and Louisiana. 20K ERG raffle announced for the integration launch.

topics.title: ChainCash and Dexy Market Applications
topics.summary: Kushti explains ChainCash as an assembly language layer for monetary systems and discusses Dexy stablecoins (Gold, Silver, Lithium) for insurance applications and international trade, particularly with tokenized real-world assets.

topics.title: Hybrid Lithium-Backed Stablecoin Design
topics.summary: Dan reveals details about Palm Economy's hybrid lithium-backed stablecoin project, designed to address logistics delays and price manipulation in lithium mining by providing algorithmic backing when physical delivery is delayed.
